column2: Gunther Larenscheld has awoken one of Nagash's most loyal Lieutanants, the Dread King, in exchange for eternal life. Now he has received the promised reward - even in death, his spirit will not leave the mortal world.
Without the limitations of a body, Larenscheld is a much more competent fighter in death than he ever could be in life.
Larenscheld's ghost haunts the living, stalking the enemies soldiers.
Larenscheld specializes in killing the biggest enemies to extingiuish their more potent life force in the name of Nagash.
Nagash allows Larenscheld's spirit to channel the winds of magic, enabling him to keep casting spells even in his ghost form.
Master of the dead in life, still master of the dead in death.
Larenscheld opens a portal through which vengeful spirits in the form of etheral skulls appear. They are crashing down on the world of the living, causing widespread destruction.
All the difficulties to finally achieve immortality make Larenscheld cling to his unlife with an iron will forged by desperation and hardship.
Larenscheld may shed his mortal form at any time voluntarily to access his superior ghost form.
No longer just a mere apparition, Larenscheld's will remains after death - and becomes much more powerful.
Luthor is Larenscheld's faithful servant. He excels at ambushing, supporting his master to get rid of pesky adventurers and keeping his master safe from daggers in the dark.
